main event: A private pilot in a Cessna aircraft nearly collided with a fast-moving, high-tailed, swept-wing aircraft while flying near Marion, Ohio on September 16, 1951.
interesting points: The pilot reported the object had a high tail and 45-degree swept-back wings.
The object was moving in a straight northward course at a speed the pilot considered high.
The pilot had to take evasive action to avoid a collision with the object.
The sighting was reported to the Air Force's Project Blue Book, which investigated UFO reports.
The Air Force concluded the sighting was likely of a conventional aircraft.
